history.narrative: Law 6-8, the “Pregnancy Anti-Discrimination Act of 1985,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-45, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Cable Television. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 16, 1985 and April 30, 1985, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 16, 1985, it was assigned Act No. 6-21 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
